titles.title: Mäṣḥafä gәbrä ḥǝmamat “Book of the Rite of the Holy Week”

shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Mäṣḥafä gәbrä ḥǝmamat “Book of the Rite of the Holy Week” (fols. 3ra-176vc) I-1) Introduction (fols. 3ra-5ra) I-2) Eve of Palm Sunday (fols. 5ra-7rb) I-3) Palm Sunday (fols. 7rb-13ra) I-4) Monday (fols. 13ra-27rc) - Night hours (fols. 13ra-15rb) - Day hours (fols. 15rb-27rc), including: Homily by John Chrysostom for Monday morning (fols. 19rb-20ra); Homily by John Chrysostom on the fig tree (fols. 20ra-23rb) I-5) Tuesday (fols. 27rc-42ra) - Night hours (fols. 27rc-34va) - Day hours (fols. 34va-42ra) I-6) Wednesday (fols. 42ra-54rb) - Night hours (fols. 42ra-43vb) - Day hours (fols. 43vb-54rb) I-7) Thursday (fols. 54rb-73rb) - Night hours (fols. 54rb-55rc) - Day hours (fols. 55rc-73rb) I-8) Friday (fols. 73rb-136vb) - Night hours (fols. 73rb-87rc), including Homily by John [Chrysostom] on Christ when He says “If it be possible, let this chalice pass” (fols. 80ra-83vc) - Day hours (fols. 88ra-136vb), including: Homily by Jaqob of Serug on Abraham (fols. 104rc-110vb); Homily by Ephrem on the Passion of Our Lord and on the thief on the right hand (fols. 118ra-118vc); Mäḥalǝyä mäḥalǝy “Song of Songs” (fols. 134rc-136vb) I-9) Saturday (fols. 136vb-168rc) - Night hours (fols. 136vb-168rc), including: Raʾǝyä Yoḥannǝs “Revelation of John” (fols. 139va-150rb); Homily by Cyriacus of Behnesa [Laḥa Maryam “Lamentation of Mary”] (fols. 152ra-162vc) I-10) Mäṣḥafä dorho “Book of the Cock” (fols. 168va-176vc)
Additiones 1-2.

copyists.copyist: Laʾǝkä Maryam is mentioned as the scribe (of text on fols. 88r-176v) in the supplication formulas on fols. 132vb, 150vb, 162vc and in a subscription on fol. 168rc. The name of the scribe of text fols. 3r-87v (cp. Additio 2) is not indicated.

donors.donor: Ḥagwäs Haftä (Habtä) Mikaʾel whose baptismal name is Täwäldä Mädḫǝn (s. Additio 3). Gäbrä Mädḫǝn is mentioned in the supplication formulas on fols. 132vb, 156vc, 168rb, 176vc (in the supplication formulas on fol. 126rb, as the commissioner of the book, and on fol. 150vb, along with ʾabunä ʿArʾaya Śǝllase). Other names are added, by a secondary hand, in the unfilled spaces left for rubrication throughout the Ms. and in Additio 2: Gäbrä Yoḥannǝs (fol. 5rc), ʾAbba Kiros (fol. 7va), Täklä ʾAb (fol. 20rb), ʾAmätä Ṣadqan (fols. 50rc, 152rc, 168vb), Gäbrä Mädḥǝn (fol. 89rb) (same as the main text?), Mäzgäbä Śǝllase (fols. 96vb, 162vc), Gäbrä Ṣadqan (fol. 162vc), Täwäldä Mädḫǝn (fols. 118ra, 162vc), Ḫabtä Mikaʾel (118vc), Gäbrä Kidan (fol. 119vc), Wälättä ʾIyäsus (fols. 132vb, 156vc, 157va, 168rb, 176vc), Wälättä Ṣǝyon (fols. 150vb, 162vc, 176vc).

dcomments.dcomment: 1893 A.M. (=1900/01 A.D.). The date is written in the ending subscription on fol. 176vc and in Additio 1.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather; remains of textile inlays. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the reddish-brown leather cover and turn-ins (at least 5 tools are used: double line fillet, double line fillet with dots, double circle, cross hatching, x-form).

bnothers.bnother: One pair of chains of endband stitches at the spine cover. Small holes are visible in the centrefold of the quires close to the tail.

squires.squire: A(3; s.l.: 1, stub after 3/fols. 1r-2av) – ፩I(10/fols. 3r-12v) – ፪II(10/fols. 13r-22v) – [፫]III(10/fols. 23r-32v) – ፬IV(9/fols. 33r-40v) – ፭V(7; s.l.: 3, stub after 5/ fols. 41r-47v) – ፮VI(8/fols. 48r-55v) – ፯VII(6/fols. 56r-61v) – ፰VIII(6; s.l.: 2, stub after 4; 5, stub after 1/fols. 62r-67v) – ፱IX(6/fols. 68r-73v) – ፲X(8/fols. 74r-81v) – ፲፩XI(6; s.l.: 1, stub after 6; 2, stub after 6/fols. 82r-87v) – XII(10/fols. 88r-97v) – ፪XIII(8/fols. 98r-105v) – ፫XIV(10/fols. 106r-115v) – ፬XV(10/fols. 116r-125v) – ፭XVI(8/fols. 126r-133v) – ፮XVII(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 6; 6, stub after 3/fols. 134r-141v) – ፯XVIII(8/fols. 142r-149v) – ፰XIX(10; s.l.: 3, stub after 7; 8, stub after 2/fols. 150r-159v) – ፱XX(8/fols. 160r-167v) – ፲XXI(10/fols. 168r-177v)

taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

rulings.ruling: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

phandwritings.phandwriting: Hand a: mediocre, irregular. Hand b: mediocre, careful.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: Hand a: fols. 1r-87v Hand b: fols. 88r-176v.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; names of the donors; name of the scribe (fols. 132vb, 150vb, 162vc, 168rc); headings and incipits of the texts, their sections and subsections; a few lines are rubricated alternating with black lines on fols. 3r, 8ra, 110vb, 118ra, 119vc, 139va, 157vb, 168va; titles of the Biblical books and other works; directives for the ministers; names of Hebrew letters in fols. 126vc-127rc (Lam. 3); the words yǝbe, yǝbǝl, yǝtärägwǝm, mätärgwǝm, nastäbäqqwǝʿ ḫabekä (fols. 68ra-68rc, Text I-7), ṣällǝyu (fols. 132va-133vb), täfäśśǝḥi (fol. 137rb); Additio 1; first lines of Additio 2; Additio 3; elements of the quire marks in fols. 3r, 33r, 41r, 48r, 62r, 68r, 74r; elements of the punctuation signs; elements of the text dividers; Ethiopic numerals or their elements.

otherdetails.otherdetail: - The work ends with a subscription mentioning the scribe´s name, the name of the commissioner and the date of writing (fol. 176vc). - On fol. 162vb, the Homily by Cyriacus of Behnesa [Laḥa Maryam “Lamentation of Mary”] (in Text I-9) ends with a note mentioning Abunä Sälama Käśate Bǝrhan as the one who have made the book written (translating?).

additional.cont: Fol. 3r: Note on the content of the codex.
additional.det: The note is written by the same hand as the one which added the names in the supplication formulas throughout the Ms., the ornamental band on fol. 3r and Additio 2.

additional.cont: Fol. 87v: Scribe's rhymed note on the completing of the work, extended with a supplication for ˀabunä ˁArˀaya Śəllase.
additional.det: The note is written by the same hand as that of the main text, partly rubricated.

The note mentions Ḥagwäs Haftä (Habtä) Mikaʾel whose baptismal name is Täwäldä Mädḫǝn, as the commissioner and the donor of the book, in 1893 A.M. (=1900/01 A.D.), and that the church of Bäläsa was built during the rule of Sǝḥul Mikaʾel (the 18th-cent. governor of Tǝgray, 1691-1777). Other members of his family are mentioned. The note is written by the same hand as that of the one who added the names in the supplication formulas throughout the Ms., the ornamental band in fol. 3r and Additio 1.

extras.extra: - Excerpts from hymns for the Good Friday (?) with musical notation are added in the upper margins of fols. 87v, 102v, 103r, 103v, 119v, 123v, 124r, 124v, 157v. - Crude notes on the margins written in blue pen in fols. 5r, 66r, 71r. - The scribe reduces the size of the script in text with musical notation, e.g., on fols. 9vc, 10rc, 10vb, 11ra, 11rc. - Minor notes, writing excercises on fols. 1r, 1v, 2r, 2v, 2ar, 176v.

txquiremarks.txquiremark: - Decorated quire marks are written (sometimes repeated twice or thrice) in the upper margin of fols. 3r, 33r, 41r, 48r, 62r, 68r, 74r; undecorated quire marks are written in the upper margin of fols. 98r, 106r, 116r, 126r, 142r, 150r, 160r, 168r.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - A piece of thread is inserted in the upper corner of fol. 132.

frames.frame: Fol. 3r: Crude coloured ornamental band (geometrical motifs) in deep violet and fuchsia (by the same hand which added names in the supplication formulas throughout the Ms. and Additiones 1, 3).
